{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with abdominal distention, fatigue, night sweats, hepatosplenomegaly, and lymph node enlargement, which are suggestive of a lymphoproliferative disorder. The photomicrograph of the biopsy specimen shows a high proliferation index (>99%) indicated by the Ki-67 staining. Based on these findings, the structure indicated by the arrows is most likely B lymphocytes, as lymphoproliferative disorders involve abnormal proliferation of B lymphocytes.", "answer_choice": "C"}
